p: Capsicum annuum L. belongs to the genus Capsicum of family Solanaceae [ 85], and is native to southern North America and northern South America [ 86]. Its fruit characteristics have been widely used for taxonomy [ 87] and have range greatly in type, colour, shape, taste and biochemical constituents [ 88]. Capsicum contains many chemicals, including water, fixed (fatty) oils, steam-volatile oil, carotenoids, capsaicinoids, resin, protein, fibre and mineral elements. Red peppers contain 280 μg/gm total carotenoids. Capsanthin accounts for 60% of the total carotenoids. They also contain 11% β-carotene and 20% capsorubin. Capsanthin is acylated with C12–18 saturated fatty acids [ 89, 90].
